intro: Acmella grandiflora var. brachyglossa, commonly known as the narrow-lipped spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a waxy texture and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden use in warm regions.
